definition: to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: The election is the Philippines' first using an electronic vote-counting system.
sentences.chinese: 这此选举是菲律宾第一次采用电子计票系统。

sentences.english: The government gave him his first patent on an electric device he called an Electrographic Vote Recorder.
sentences.chinese: 政府为他的电记录计票器颁发了第一个专利。

sentences.english: You are the agents of change and the tellers of truth.
sentences.chinese: 你是变革的代理人和真理的计票员。

sentences.english: In South Carolina, it was a massive get-out-the-vote effort.
sentences.chinese: 在南卡罗莱纳，是工作量很大的计票工作。

sentences.english: Partial counts have Mr. al-Maliki leading in two predominantly Shiite provinces. But Mr.
sentences.chinese: 部分计票显示，马利基在两个什叶派主导的省份领先。

sentences.english: The ballots are counted by hand, with each accountant responsible for one fourth of the total.
sentences.chinese: 人工计票的方法，每位统计师总票数的四分。

sentences.english: The recount is a practical necessity but has no basis in electoral law.
sentences.chinese: 重新计票有实际的必要性，却无选举法作为法律基础。

definition: to read ballot slips out loud
